meanings.definition: To remove dust or dirt from something by brushing or wiping it.
meanings.sent1: I need to dustoff the bookshelf before guests arrive.
meanings.sent2: She always dusts off the old photographs before putting them back on the shelf.
meanings.sent3: After the cat walked across the table, I had to dustoff the crumbs it left behind.
meanings.sent4: The janitor had to dustoff the forgotten corners of the classroom.
meanings.sent5: The wind helped to dustoff the leaves from the sidewalk.

meanings.definition: A brand of compressed air used to clean electronic equipment.
meanings.sent1: I used a can of dustoff to clean my computer keyboard.
meanings.sent2: The IT technician always carries a can of dustoff in his toolbox.
meanings.sent3: When the computer overheated, I sprayed some dustoff to cool it down.
meanings.sent4: The dustoff can hissed as I sprayed it on the dusty fan.
meanings.sent5: The dustoff cleared the dust from the computer vents in seconds.

meanings.definition: A helicopter used for medical evacuation.
meanings.sent1: The dustoff arrived quickly to transport the injured hiker to the hospital.
meanings.sent2: The military uses dustoff helicopters to rescue wounded soldiers from the battlefield.
meanings.sent3: The dustoff pilot skillfully landed the helicopter in the narrow clearing.
meanings.sent4: The sound of the dustoff rotor blades echoed through the valley.
meanings.sent5: The dustoff crew worked efficiently to load the patient onto the helicopter.
